page.title: 03History
page.content: Our block has a long long history.It contains{Morton Island}which was the first place inhabited in Scotland.In the early Stone age the land around {Morton}was completely covered with sea and mud flats.Around{6000BC}a group of 12 people came and camped on {Morton Island.}The land since then has grown rapidly and is now thriving forest land where deer and rabbit prosper. Tayport also had the first{rail {ferry}in the world.It ran from Tayport harbour over the river Tay and was built by{Thomas Bouch}in 1846.He also built the more famous Tay rail bridge which collapsed in 1879. Tayport no longer has a rail connection with the outside world since the Tay road bridge was built in 1966.
